sentences.en: A soft hairdo helped to subdue her heavy features.
sentences.cn: 柔和的发型使她忧郁的模样变得好看些了.

sentences.en: an excitement she could not subdue
God gave it to man to protect and subdue.
sentences.cn: 上帝把它交给人类管理和保存.

sentences.en: He forced himself to subdue and overcome his fears.
sentences.cn: 他强迫自己克制并战胜恐惧心理。

sentences.en: He must exert himself to subdue so proud a display of resentment.
sentences.cn: 他必须施展本事,征服这种因忌恨而产生的骄傲.

sentences.en: He must subdue her, absorb her, rip her apart and consume her.
sentences.cn: 他立意要征服她, 吞了她, 不惜把她撕碎把她榨干.

sentences.en: His care to subdue his voice made It'sound monotonous.
sentences.cn: 他故意把声音压得很低,听起来十分单调.

sentences.en: His fears returned and he couldn't subdue them.
sentences.cn: 他的恐惧感又控制了他,他无法使这种恐惧得到缓和.
拿破仑控制了大半个欧洲。

sentences.en: Police managed to subdue the angry crowd.
sentences.cn: 警察设法控制住了愤怒的人群。

sentences.en: Senior government officials admit they have not been able to subdue the rebels.
sentences.cn: 高级政府官员们承认他们还没能制服反叛者们。

sentences.en: She tried to subdue her anger.
sentences.cn: 她尽力压制自己的怒火.

sentences.en: Soames made a tour of the room, to subdue his rising anger.
sentences.cn: 索米斯在屋内兜了一圈, 压制一下心头升起的怒火.

sentences.en: The appropriate antibiotic may subdue the initial organism.
sentences.cn: 适当的抗菌素可能抑制最初的细菌.

sentences.en: The magistrates wanted to raise some strength to subdue the rioters.
sentences.cn: 地方行政长官想纠集一些力量来镇压乱民.

sentences.en: The police used tear gas to subdue the rioters.
sentences.cn: 警察使用了催泪瓦斯来镇压骚乱分子.

sentences.en: This yellow belt novice is allowed to subdue his more experienced comrade.
sentences.cn: 这位黄带的新手获许制服比他更有经验的同伴.

sentences.en: To subdue one's self and return to propriety, is perfect virtue.
Troops were called in to subdue the rebels.
sentences.cn: 军队被调来镇压反叛者。

words.tran_cn: 减弱的；被制服的；被抑制的
使服从，压制，减弱（subdue 的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to bring sb/sth under control, especially by using force
to defeat or control a person or group, especially using force
